metadata.title: Global Memory Bank Reorganization Branch Context

content.purpose: Reorganize and clean up the Global Memory Bank to improve navigation, reduce file count, standardize document structure, and optimize the tag system.

userStories.description: As a developer, I want to reduce the number of files in the Global Memory Bank by consolidating related documents so that the structure is more manageable.
As a team member, I want a more intuitive categorization of documents so that I can find relevant information more quickly.
As a contributor, I want a standardized tagging system with clear categories so that documents can be properly tagged and found through search.
As a maintainer, I want to simplify the index structure so that it's more maintainable and consistent.

implementationPlan.summary: An 8-phase implementation plan has been created to systematically reorganize the Global Memory Bank

phases.name: Backup and Preparation
phases.description: Create backups and analyze file relationships and dependencies

phases.name: File Consolidation
phases.description: Merge related documents into comprehensive documents with clear sections

phases.name: Tag Reorganization
phases.description: Implement tag categories and consolidate similar tags

phases.name: Documentation Improvement
phases.description: Standardize document types, add proper section structure, and ensure consistent language

phases.name: Directory Restructuring
phases.description: Create category-based directories and move documents accordingly

phases.name: Index Updates
phases.description: Update both index files and enhance the tag index format

phases.name: Verification and Testing
phases.description: Perform functional testing, document review, and user acceptance testing

phases.name: Final Cleanup
phases.description: Delete redundant files, update global documentation, and create a change summary
